characters: FOUND DEAD, VICTIM OF FREAK FISHING ACCIDENT."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Three men sit at a window booth drinking coffee and talking. Two of the men sit on one side of the table; STANLEY is in his early thirties, AGENT ROBERTS, early forties. Both wear suits, the younger's is fairly expensive and well cut, the other's is polyester, enough said. The MAN across, however, is quite different. He is what they used to call a "cool-cat."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take Dog Day Afternoon for example. Arguably Pacino's greatest performance, excepting The Godfather, Part I, and Scarface, of course. A masterpiece of directing, easily Lumet's best. The acting, the script, cinematography, all top notch. But, they didn't push the envelope. What if in Dog Day, Sonny really wanted to get away with it? What if, and here's where it gets tricky. What if they'd started killing hostages? No mercy, no quarter, meet our demands or the cute blonde in the bell bottoms gets one in the back of the head, bam, splatter. What? Still no bus?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How many innocent victims would they let get sprayed across the windows before the city reversed its policy on hostage situations? And this was 1976. No C.N.N., no C.N.B.C., no M.T.V. No Internet. Fast forward to the present, same situation. Can you imagine the feeding frenzy of the modern media? In hours it would be the top story from Boston to Budapest. All caught in 150 millimeter zoom, computer enhanced, and color corrected. You would practically taste the brain matter. Six hostages die. Ten. Twelve. Twenty. Thirty. Relentless. One after another. All over a bus, a plane, and a couple of million dollars that were federally insured. He sits, letting the pictures sink in, then:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just a thought. I mean it's not really within the realm of conventional cinema, but what if...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, this movie of yours, I don't think it would have worked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really?   How come?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shrugs)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Audiences love happy endings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pacino escapes. With the money. Boyfriend gets the sex change operation. They live happily ever after. Stanley shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Homophobia? Stanley shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bad guy can't win. It's a morality tale. One way or the other, he's gotta go down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, well. Life does tend to be stranger than fiction. (looking at watch)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, guys, gotta jet. This place is kinda dead. CAMERA PANS AROUND the coffee shop. Not a soul in the place. We CONTINUE TO PAN AROUND 270 DEGREES TO the front door, which is open. Outside the open doorway are crouched a squad of heavily body-armored SWAT members, packed together, and aiming automatic weapons inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks for the coffee. He gets up. In his left hand, which has been hidden by the table until now, he is holding a strange-looking spring-loaded grip. Gabriel is looking back at them. Smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rene Descartes is sitting in some bar in Paris. Bartender says, 'Hey, you want another drink?' Descartes says, 'I think not.' And disappears. He smiles at his own joke, then turns and walks over to the front door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Move. No one even twitches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I won't ask again.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: He lifts up the device in his left hand.

dialogues.speaker: ROBERTS
dialogues.text: who nods his head. The SWAT team moves back, letting Gabriel out of the coffee shop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you. Gabriel looks back at Stan sitting in the booth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stanley... you coming? Stan slides from the booth as Gabriel exits the coffee shop --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SILENCE -- no sounds on the SOUNDTRACK. Gabriel and Stanley stop just outside the doorway. Gabriel dons a pair of hip little shades, then continues across the sidewalk and into the street. He nonchalantly looks up. Suddenly the THUMP of HELICOPTERS and the WAIL of SIRENS dominates the soundtrack. Pandemonium. HELICOPTERS RIP the sky, L.A. County PD and a bunch of news vultures. Squad cars block off both ends of the street while SWAT trucks, news vans, and looky- loos are packed together into the distance. Sharpshooters lean out of windows and snipers are positioned on every open rooftop. Hundreds of weapons are pointed at this man who saunters across the street as if he's on his way to Sunday service, without a care in the world. Slowly, Stanley follows Gabriel into the street. Gabriel steps up on the far sidewalk, a huge armored bus blocks most of the windows. He walks beside the bus, under a huge "WORLD BANC" sign, and through the glass front door, which shuts IN OUR FACE.

dialogues.speaker: GABRIEL
dialogues.text: He turns away from the window and we FOLLOW him.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: The interior of the bank looks like New Orleans on Fat Tuesday. Three Hummers sit in the middle of the floor, surrounded by broken glass. Between them rests a bright red Ferrari F50 (Gabriel's). All but one of the front windows of the bank, the one with the door in it, has been welded over with 3/4 inch plate steel. Over two dozen hostages lie face down on the floor, arms cable-tied behind their backs. Something has been duct- taped around their chests and each is wearing what appears to be a dog collar. The other occupants of the room are nine men. All of whom would look as if they were attending the fashion event of the year were it not for the automatic weapons each one carries.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How we doin'? One of the ARMED MEN finishes putting a collar on a young, normally good-looking-but-now-covered-in-mascara, whimpering blonde girl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Done.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good.   Take her out. SUPERIMPOSE:    FRIDAY, OCTOBER 18     8:41:22... The front door opens and one of the suited men drags out the pretty blonde from earlier. She is sobbing and is in such grief she can't even walk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the sidewalk, the suited man, his automatic weapon slung, holds her up for everyone to see.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gabriel grabs his cell and dials.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roberts sits in the Starbucks which has been transformed into a high-tech command center reading a newspaper.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: We cannot see the headlines. Federal and state officers scramble around handling problems. The PHONE RINGS. Assistant Director Bill Joy (A.D. JOY), an older-looking guy who looks more like an accountant than an assistant director of the FBI, is handed the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is everyone in position?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Almost, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looks up from paper)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing? We PAN AROUND.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to SWAT LEADER)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get her at your first opportunity.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into mike)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: High ground one and two. You have a green light.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've seen what this man is capable of --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The F.B.I. does not negotiate with terrorists. I assumed you'd be aware of that. (answering phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joy. Roberts picks up an extension.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't talk, listen... When I made my Dog Day Afternoon analogy, I was not speaking metaphorically. We have 22 hostages. Each has been wrapped with 20 pounds of C-four explosives.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SWAT guys making their way to the roof of the bank.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On top of that we have taped 15 pounds of stainless steel ball bearings --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- making them the world's largest walking Claymore mines.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: aiming down at Gabriel's merc. The merc is holding up the weeping girl so everyone can see what Gabriel is talking about. Unbeknownst to him, red laser aiming dots appear on Gab's merc's chest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stanley is being held by two of the well-dressed men.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Around her neck is a radio- frequency electronic dog collar --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roberts stops short as he hears this.   He and Joy both look at each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dog walks out of his yard, he gets the shit shocked out of him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hearing this, Roberts stands back up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop them --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In SLOW MOTION, A.D. Joy jumps for his radio.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Same thing --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- their yard is this bank.      So, don't fuck with me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SWAT members move into position along the peripheral. The merc turns toward them. The momentum swings his shouldered weapon upward in SLOW MOTION.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into mike) Hold your --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The SWAT snipers take this weapon movement as an aggressive act and FIRE into the merc, the BULLETS RIPPING into him. He drops. A SWAT-armored vehicle rushes in -- one of the team jumps out, in an attempt to rescue the woman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No!   Noooo!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hysterical, the hostage runs back toward the bank, confusing the SWAT guy trying to rescue her. He reaches for her but she fights him. Finally, he grabs her around the waist and carries her on his shoulder into the street as she screams toward the bank for help.

dialogues.speaker: HIS FOOT, (SLOW MOTION)
dialogues.text: as he steps off the sidewalk.

dialogues.speaker: GIRL, (SLOW MOTION)
dialogues.text: She is screaming nooooo!

dialogues.speaker: HIS FOOT, (SLOW MOTION)
dialogues.text: as it continues its stride.

dialogues.speaker: RADIO DOG COLLAR, (SLOW MOTION)
dialogues.text: Around her neck.    The green light blinks to red.   BEEP NORMAL SPEED.

dialogues.speaker: KABOOM
dialogues.text: BALL BEARINGS RICOCHET against the plate steel of the bank.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ball bearings bounce across the street and tap against the coffee shop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone in the coffee shop looks at each other like, "What just happened?"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As ball bearings roll back into the street.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: AXL TORVALDS enters customs. A thirty-something European who could easily pass for a season regular on "Sprockets." We PULL BACK. Torvalds is watching anxiously as his bags are torn into like Christmas day at the Griswalds. The two CUSTOMS AGENTS eye his three laptops suspiciously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (heavy Finnish accent) Please be careful --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- one of the Agents cuts off his plea with a glance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to himself, almost inaudibly) -- that equipment is quite expensive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Torvalds is wary of time. After several moments his bags are being repacked when another passport is found. The customs official holds up two passports. ANOTHER CUSTOMS OFFICIAL takes them and walks over to Torvalds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Torvalds. Could you step over here, please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Torvalds glances at his watch.    1:45 PM.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How long am I going to be delayed?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It'll be just a moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Torvalds stands to the side, while two customs officials compare his passports. They step over to a computer terminal and punch in some data. It's 1:50 PM. Torvalds notices a customs department employee wheeling a cart of confiscated items out of a nearby service elevator. He pushes the cart out of the oversized elevator. Torvalds shoots a glance back to the two officials discussing his situation. Torvalds casually picks up his computer case and coolly walks over to the elevator.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Torvalds walks in just as the doors close. The customs officials conferring look around. Torvalds is gone. One of them looks up and sees the numbers changing above the elevator. The customs officials race up to the escalator to the --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Torvalds exits the elevator -- and coolly makes his way to the pedestrian walkway. He's halfway across it, when -- multiple security teams appear and converge on him from both ends. He's finally wrestled to the ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (flipping a badge in Torvalds' face) Axl Torvalds. You are under arrest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SENATOR JAMES REISMAN -- R. (Georgia) strides confidently into a small, windowless boardroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This better be important, you pulled me out of session.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DARWIN KAPLAN, the President's aide and one of the four men in the room, definitely the most intense, smiles thinly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Senator, I wouldn't have asked you to come here if it wasn't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Senator starts to sit down.    Kaplan turns toward th Senator.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Senator, we just received a communication that Axl Torvalds was intercepted entering the continental U.S.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Within the last two hours. According to our source inside the F.B.I., he was nabbed coming through customs at L.A.X. Alone...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do they know who they are dealing with?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is unlikely, sir. It was a routine check and Torvalds freaked out. They just got lucky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This ain't good, boys. The Vortex has used Torvalds before. What do the feds know?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing as of yet. He's refusing to speak English and the Finnish consulate has already contacted the State Department...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So we haven't been compromised?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're not sure. We're working on that right now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You better get sure real quick, son, 'cause someone's cock's liable to end up on the block on this one. And I promise you it won't be mine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Senator, I think we'll be okay here --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't fucking pay you to think, Kaplan. I pay you to keep me informed. I know the Vortex. That's why I voted against using him on American soil.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's like using the Ebola virus to cure a cancer patient. Son, what do you think's going to happen if he starts tying up loose ends.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They look at each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yessir.   I understand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We are indeed in the middle of nowhere, no nothing as far as you can see. We CONTINUE TO CRANE UP, a $140,000 Ferrari Modena flies down the road in a cloud of suspended gravel toward Stanley's dilapidated, piece-o'- crap trailer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stan stands on the roof of his trailer, which was a dilapidated shack in the 1950s and now is a lot worse. chained but scruffy-looking Rottweiler runs around in front of the trailer. Stan looks completely different than he did in the opening sequence. He hasn't taken very good care of himself. His hair is long, and right now standing on end. He is wearing nothing but a dirty towel, and is slicing golf balls off the roof. Whack. As the Ferrari drives up he begins hitting golf balls at it, but he just isn't very good. Nevertheless, after a dozen bad hits, a lucky shot ricochets off the aluminum hood.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE
dialogues.text: Stan smiles as the car slides to a halt in the gravel driveway, and turns back to his "work."

dialogues.speaker: STANLEY
dialogues.text: As we hear the DOOR SHUT and SOMEONE COMES UP the aluminum extension ladder. A few moments later, in SLOW MOTION, GINGER appears at the top of the ladder and steps onto the trailer's roof. Stan turns around. She is what the hack writers of the Thirties would call a vision. Thesauruses could be exhausted searching for adjectives that do her justice. In the low-rent light of Stanley's white trash haven, she is, by definition, a goddess.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who are you supposed to be?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHACK (slice). She lights a cigarette, inhales deeply, then exhales.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello, Stanley.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She knows his name.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm Ginger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHACK (slice).

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For someone the N.S.A. has listed as the most dangerous hacker in America, you sure don't look like much.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHACK (slice).

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't look so surprised. I know everything there is to know about you, Stan. From your mom's maiden name to how big your...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She glances downward then back up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bank account is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How'd you get past my dog?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (cute) Boys like me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Great.   What are you selling again?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHACK (slice).

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did I say I was selling something? I'm here to help you, Stan. Look at you, you're a mess.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHACK (slice).

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My employer wants to meet you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHACK (slice).

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not very good at this, are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're fucking up my chi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I see that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Begrudgingly he hands her the club. She tees up a ball, pulls up her skirt far enough to reveal thong, and whack, hits a ball that Tiger Woods would envy. CLANG. She smiles, hands him the club back and pulls down her skirt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You need to straighten your left arm. You're bending it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trust me.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: He does and the ball goes flying 200 yards, perfect, whacking a fridge with "200 YARDS" painted on it. CLANG! Stan looks at the club, then tosses it to the ground, climbing back down an aluminum extension ladder that leads up through a makeshift hatch on the roof.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She follows but Stan ignores her and walks into his bedroom. She walks over, opens, and reaches into the fridge --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is not a nice place you have here, Stanley.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- and pulls out a beer --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've only been here a few minutes and I'm already starting to feel sorry for myself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She walks into:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stan walks back in, looking for semi-clean clothes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're wasting your time. I even touch a computer, I go straight to Leavenworth, do not pass go, do not collect 200 dollars. Whatever I was...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stanley, pulling on his pants, lets the sentence hang, unfinished. He's putting on his shoes. She squats down in front of him, resting her hand on his leg.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stanley, think about it, they still teach your techniques at

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She smiles up at him, then takes a long drink of her beer. Stan stares at her a moment, then...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not here to suck your dick, Stanley, you can sit around doing the martyr thing as long as you like. He'll pay you just to meet you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiles) I gotta go to work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh that's right, and fine work it is, too. (beat) Stanley... (beat) Have you spoken to Holly lately?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She just dropped a 20 megaton thermonuclear warhead into Stanley's universe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stanley practically pitches her down the steps of his trailer and slams the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A TELEPHONE RINGS in a multi-zillion dollar Malibu beach house. A WOMAN, late twenties, grabs the receiver. Her voice is of perfect timbre and accentless.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Melissa... (beat) Holly home?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (New York starts to invade her accentless accent) Stanley. Why are you calling here?

dialogues.speaker: STANLEY
dialogues.text: on phone. He stands in front of his now closed fridge. It is covered with pictures of his daughter, Holly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want to talk with Holly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INTERCUT BETWEEN the two. Melissa's accent continues to travel eastward from Midwest flat to full tilt Long Island.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's... (looks at her watch) It's twelve-thirty, Stanley. She's in school. You know it's illegal for you to talk to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't do this, Mel. It's not good for Holly --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How the hell would you know what is or isn't good for my daughter? You've spent the last two years in prison.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mel --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop calling me that, Stanley.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just want to see my baby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, she doesn't want to see you, Stanley, and I swear to fucking God, if you contact her, I'll have Larry's attorney throw you into a hole so deep and dark it'll make Leavenworth seem like two weeks in Vegas; during which I'll personally pay two ball-busting skin-heads to --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wow, Mel, you can take the girl out of the trailer park, but you can't take the trailer park out of the girl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She regains control.       Her voice is accentless once a

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (exhaling) I will not let myself be manipulated by you, Stanley. Larry's her father now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Larry's the porn king --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Larry's a film financier, a good husband, and an astute businessman. What films he's involved in are a function of profitability and none of your business.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She is now downright icy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get help, Stanley, get into a program, get a therapist, get a dog, but whatever you do, stay away from my child.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your child?    She's our child.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She will never be your child. You'll never have the kind of money to match Larry's lawyers in court. Forget Holly.

dialogues.speaker: CLICK.
dialogues.text: The PHONE GOES DEAD. Stanley freaks, beats the receiver against the fridge, again, and again. Then, he calmly hangs up the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stanley walks down the steps of his trailer. Ginger sits on the hood of her car in all her estrogenic glory, smoking and petting Stan's dog.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stanley's dog leans against her, happy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to dog, like "traitor") Judas.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello, Stanley.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She smiles at him. He smiles back, about ready to stick her in the trunk of her car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, I'm beginning to lose my sense of humor about --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's cut through the bullshit, Stan. If you ever want to have a chance in hell of getting your daughter back you'll shut up and listen. Unless of course you want to stay here in your pathetic, loser life while she learns what it's like to be a fluffer in one of her new daddy's videos.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do me the courtesy of not confusing your own childhood with my daughter's.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look at your situation, Stanley. For twenty months you've been in court six times, each time your custody case has been thrown out. Your situation doesn't look good, sweetheart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She blows smoke at him, thinking, then whips out her trump card.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How much would it cost to retain the best family lawyer in the country and regain custody of your daughter?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All the way through the jury trial?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A lot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She pulls out a large manila envelope. Opens it and dumps the rubber-banded stacks of hundreds onto the ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This should get you started.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stanley just stares at the money.     He looks up at Ging

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whattaya have to lose? Just meet him. One time. That's it. You don't like the setup, walk away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's it.   And you keep the money.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: She smokes, letting it all sink in. She puts out her cigarette. They just stare at each other. She smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Torvalds sits at a table in a room with a two-way mirror. To his left, a three-piece suited Euroweasel (obviously his LAWYER) nurses a steaming cup of coffee while providing air cover from the two interrogating FBI Agents. The table is covered with empty coffee cups and cigarette carcasses. Roberts eases quietly into the room in mid- interrogation. Torvalds says something in Finnish to his Lawyer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did he say?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Torvalds again speaks to his Lawyer in Finnish.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your client is wanted on 24 counts of electronic crimes in seven different countries --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Finland does not recognize these allegations as crimes. Your laws --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you see a Finnish flag hanging on the wall, Ikea boy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Torvalds speaks to his Lawyer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did he say?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He said Ikea is Swedish.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He understands English?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The FBI Agent's head is now close to imploding.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay... Guys, why don't you give me a few minutes here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They turn to see Roberts smiling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh, sir...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's okay.   Just a couple of minutes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yessir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've fucked up now, Hamlet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (never taking his eyes off Torvalds) And Michaels.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yessir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hamlet was a Dane.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adane?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forget it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roberts sits down in a chair facing Torvalds.     He star at him a moment, just smiling, then...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why would the number one cracker in the world risk life imprisonment to enter the continental U.S.?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My client has repeatedly reserved his right not answer any questions at this time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Torvalds looks at Roberts' badge and says something in Finnish, the only recognizable word being "Roberts." The attorney and Torvalds both laugh. Roberts looks at the attorney.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He told me to tell Mister Roberts that he is quite fond of 'The X-Files.'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Again they smile. Roberts looks at the lawyer's cup of steaming coffee and with one finger pushes it over into the lawyer's lap.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You need another cup of coffee --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (jumping up in great pain) Goddammit!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roberts grabs him by the collar and slams him into the wall, then pushes him out the door with a kick in the ass. He grabs the briefcase and tosses it out after him and locks the door. He turns on Torvalds, smacking him across the face. He pushes him into the wall and holds his badge in front of him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Until a year ago I was head of the largest task force on cyber- criminals in the entire world. But, I burned out. It happens. I snapped. I shot a suspect in the fucking hand. Accident. Do you know how hard it is to work a keyboard with one hand?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whatever you can do to me, he can do worse. I'm already dead. The only place I stand a chance is back in my country. I have friends there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I tell you what, you tell me what I want to know and I guarantee you'll be on the next flight to Finland. First class. Courtesy of the U.S. Government.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Torvalds thinks quietly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two FBI agents (BAD AGENTS #1 & 2) watch the interrogation through a two-way mirror. One of the agents looks surprisingly like Gabriel's merc that carried the young blonde girl killed outside the bank earlier.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (over speaker)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll tell you what I know. The Agents look at each other.    Bad Agent #1 dials his cell phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into his cell)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, this is Assistant Director Joy, would you find Agent Roberts. It's important that I speak with him as soon as possible. Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who is he?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A yellow Lamborghini Diablo drives up. In SLOW MOTION Gabriel steps out of the car, wind whipping his full- length, black Gucci overcoat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He exists in a world beyond your world. What we only fantasize, he does. He lives a life where nothing is beyond him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But it is all an act.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gabriel walks through the crowd as if a celebrity --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For all his charisma and charm. For all his wealth and expensive toys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- exchanging kisses and the lingering of hands, as he slides through parting seas of beautiful people.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beneath it all he is a driven, unflinching, calculating machine, who takes what he wants, when he wants, then disappears --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- It works like this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I fly to where I am to meet him. He sends one of his people to meet me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A BOEING 777 SCREAMS overhead. We TILT DOWN. Stanley and Ginger walk out of LAX. A white LIMO IDLES directly in front of them. Stanley is wearing a black T-shirt which proclaims in large white letters across his chest, in true Scarlet Letter fashion, "LOSER!"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He tells me what he needs. I do my job, I'm paid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Upstairs on a lavish balcony Gabriel looks at the crowd.

dialogues.speaker: GABRIEL
dialogues.text: smiling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I leave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's a real nice story.    But you haven't given me shit. Torvalds knows this and smiles at Roberts arrogantly. The door opens, an FBI AGENT sticks his head in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me, sir... you have a call.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, take a message.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's Assistant Director Joy, he said it's important.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At least it's not my wife. (to Torvalds)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You need to think about what else you know. (then, to Agent #1)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watch him. Roberts walks out of the room.    The FBI Agent positions himself outside the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roberts walks out of the room.    Torvalds' attorney is there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You will be hearing from my gover --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up. Roberts walks down the hall. The attorney, pissed, walks back into the interrogation room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One of the two Agents watches the door, the other, Bad Agent #2 steps over to the two-way mirror.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Torvalds talks to his attorney in Finnish. Apparently his attorney is trying to convince him of something. Torvalds, unfazed, walks over to the one-way mirror. PULL BACK FROM Torvalds to reveal Bad Agent #2 calmly screwing a silencer on to his .45. Torvalds leans closer to the glass. Bad Agent #2 sticks the silenced barrel of the gun up against the glass -- right between the eyes of Torvalds. Bad Agent #2 moves the barrel up and down between Torvalds face and neck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Torvalds looks smugly into the glass.    He lifts his han holding up his middle finger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bad Agent #2 moves his aim to Torvalds' tonsils.   He depresses the trigger slightly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Torvalds, middle finger in the air, smiles. Unbeknownst to him however, a tiny red aiming laser has zipped through the glass and is now positioned as a dot on Torvalds' throat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Satisfied with the placement he PULLS the TRIGGER...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roberts walks down the hall and turns right into --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roberts picks up the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is Roberts, I have a call from A.D. Joy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hold, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Finally --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roberts.   You needed me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You didn't call me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You just called me...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Realization slowly hits him, he drops the phone and runs from the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roberts runs down the hall and into:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roberts finds Torvalds and his attorney dead.     Roberts looks into the mirror. Six clean bullet holes perforate his reflection.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A huge, lavish, converted theater in downtown Los Angeles. A 21st Century version of 54 on equal overdoses of steroids and acid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stanley and Ginger walk into a large area with individual private booths in small rooms around the perimeter. The rooms have the ability to be closed off by drawing huge, thick velvet drapes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wish you'd let me buy you a suit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm happy with what I'm wearing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have no self-esteem, Stanley.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (dryly) I know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They walk into one of the booths in the back. Sitting around a large, oval table is our antihero, Gabriel Shear, surrounded by a handful of his crew and a gaggle of beautiful model-types. Ginger kisses Gabriel and with a healthy exchange of fluids, then...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miss me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gabriel smiles, then looks back at Stanley.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gabriel, Stanley. Stanley, Gabriel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gabriel just stares.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (very familiar) Big Stan. Nice suit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, they say it's the clothes that make the man...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You buy it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hope not. (then) Buy you a drink?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I flew fifteen hundred miles for this meeting, how 'bout we get to the point.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Actually you flew 1500 miles for 100 grand. But that's not the point.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stanley sits down.    Gabriel pours Stan a glass of Crown

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I heard this story about this young hacker who made a virus that broke the F.B.I.'s Carnivore program that was actively reading every subscriber's E-mail and scrambled the systems. He did what the federal judges wouldn't do and kept the government out of our Privacy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think I heard that. Story is he went to jail and the federal Carnivore program is back in full swing. It was a real tragedy. What can I do for you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Changing the subject.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stanley, meet Helga.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gabriel smiles. The beautiful WOMAN to Stanley's right slides closer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (heavily accented) Hi, Stanley.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stanley looks at her, she's a knockout; artificially perfect. He looks back at Gabriel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, I don't have a lot of patience for this --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stanley, we have a problem, maybe you can help us out.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Stan looks around; everyone is smiling.       Helga moves closer to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take a look at this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He is handed an open laptop, it glows. He sets it on the table and spins it around in front of Stanley.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (like an alcoholic faced with a fifth of tequila) You know I can't touch that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Helga pours a shot of tequila.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You like tequila, Stanley?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Helga shoots the tequila, then turns to Stanley, places her lips against his. The gold liquid drips from their lips as she spits it into Stanley's mouth. He pushes her away, breaking the liplock, and swallowing the tequila. She licks it from his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No need for modesty, we're all friends here, Stanley.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is bullshit. I came --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want something from me, amigo, I want something from you. D.O.D. dBase, 128 bit R.S.A. encryption. Whattaya think? Impossible?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stanley's having a little trouble concentrating on Gabriel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing's impossible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Helga begins sucking on Stanley's fingers.      He pulls away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So it can be done? Maybe slide in a Trojan horse hiding a worm?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something like that. Is this an interview?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sort of. Marco, let's give him some incentive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The drapes close. Two of Gabriel's crew step out. Marco yanks out a .40 caliber Glock and quickly screws a well- used silencer onto the end. Marco walks around behind Stanley.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (now totally confused) What are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Helga smiles, then drops her head into Stanley's lap. hear his PANTS UNZIP.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Relax, Stanley.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He has to go with it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've been told the best crackers in the world could do this in sixty minutes. Unfortunately, I need someone who can do it in sixty seconds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're kidding...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Fraid not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stan realizes now no one is smiling.    He grabs the blon by the hair but can't pull her up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forty-five seconds. Time is a wasting, big guy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The silencer is pressed into the back of his head. Stanley tries to focus on the screen. Stanley sucks air through his teeth, trying to focus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have thirty seconds, Stanley.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Stanley gives up on trying to get her up and his hands start flying over the keyboard. We INTERCUT the ACTION WITH a CLOSEUP of Stanley's hands working the keyboard, and a CLOSEUP of Gabriel, and a CLOSEUP of the LCD screen which reads in flashing red letters --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's very good, isn't she, Stanley?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tension builds as Stanley continues to work the keyboard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mon, Stanley. 20 seconds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fifteen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ten... Nine...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Faster and faster.       "ACCESS DENIED."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Three... Two...

dialogues.speaker: "ACCESS DENIED."
dialogues.text: He grabs her head.       She doesn't come up.   The scree flashes:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Too bad, Stanley. Ya gotta die.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marco puts the silencer to his eye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait... !

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLICK. The GUN is empty. Stanley tries to catch his breath. Helga lifts up her head. Everyone laughs. Gabriel walks around the table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was just fucking with you, Stan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stanley is pissed. Helga, smiling, kisses him on the cheek. Stanley tries to calm down. He gets up, shoots someone's half-drank drink, zips his pants, then --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So was I.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stanley hits the enter key and spins the computer around.

dialogues.speaker: COMPUTER SCREEN
dialogues.text: "ACCESS GRANTED" appears, and the Department of Defense logo scrolls across the screen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stanley gives them all a "fuck you" smile, then stomps out through the curtain.

dialogues.speaker: GABRIEL
dialogues.text: who smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stanley pushes into the bathroom.       He kicks the wastebasket across the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He pushes a club kid out of the way of the sink. He turns on the water and washes his face. Slowly he leans his forehead against the mirror. Ginger appears behind him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you looking at?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Relax, Stanley. You can do this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get away from me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want to help you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Help? Help what, squeegee my brain off the ceiling?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was just a test, Stan, you passed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ginger pulls out a cigarette and a lighter from her plastic overcoat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A test... I don't know why I let you talk me into this. I can't believe how desperate I am.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She exhales toward Stanley.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought you were here saving your daughter, Stanley.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He turns around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pissed) Look... I'd do anything to get Holly back. But, if I end up in a box or back in jail, then I really can't help her, can I? What I should do, is take my money and go back to court.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Back to court? Back to Melissa's gladiators? You throw a hundred grand at her, she'll throw five back at you. It's not about Holly, it's about beating you. You know that. Think, Stanley.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What I'm thinking about is that you're willing to put a gun to my head to see if I can hack --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly three club kids come busting into the bathroom.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Ginger interrupts him by slamming Stan between the urinals and ramming her tongue into his mouth with the kind of wet, aggressive action that takes a movie from PG-13 to an R. When the kids realize that the urinals are occupied, they leave. Slowly Ginger takes her tongue out of Stan's mouth. They look at each other. She smiles at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (coyly) Sorry...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A beat, for a moment there exists something between them, then bam, she's all business again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, let me sum it up for you, Stanley. You live in a trailer. (beat) You're a felon, working a dead- end job. You want to get Holly back, Gabriel's your only shot.

dialogues.speaker: STANLEY
dialogues.text: As he realizes she's right, he's got nothing to lose. Slam! He smacks the mirror with his fist, then walks out of the rest room. Ginger slowly lifts the cigarette. She exhales, then slowly smiles. She's got him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Next to the valet stand, Gabriel leans over the hood of an evil-looking, bright-yellow Lamborghini Diablo Roadster, a GAMEBOY CHIRPING in his hands. Stanley walks INTO the FRAME.          Without missing a Gabriel looks up --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Big Stan.   I was afraid we lost you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gabriel stands up and walks toward Stan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell me what the deal is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's go up to the house. I'm having a little get-together. I'll explain it to you there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gabriel smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Three GEEKY COMPUTER-TYPES sit in front of a huge array of CRTs. They look up when Roberts stalks into the room. He yanks off his jacket, crumbles it and throws it across the room. They just look at each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell me you have some good news for me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Actually we have a small ray of hope in the vast darkness that is your life, sir. Check this out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On one of the 25-inch screens we see a terminal at LAX with hundreds of people streaming by at 20x speed. Torvalds is being apprehended. He freezes it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See these two guys?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He points at two men watching this action from the sideline. He pulls another monitor forward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now watch this...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He fast-forwards through the crowd until the two guys show up again. He freezes it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Recognize those two, same guys, next day. Question is --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He slowly moves the action forward --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- who's that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The footage stops and zooms in on one of two travelers who the two men are meeting.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: It is Stanley.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stanley Jobson...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The computer guys look at each other.    One hands Robert an open copy of Wired magazine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wired's man of the year, 1996. Pretty much a burnout but he was the hacker zeitgeist of his day --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know who Jobson is. I busted him. (to Stan's image) Why are you in L.A.?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roberts looks at it. Then at the screen.        A pop-up screen shows Stanley's history.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His ex-wife lives in Malibu.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The new husband owns Backdoor Films, a shady porn production house in Chatsworth. Decent production value but they only shoot on video. His wife actually starred in a couple of his videos. Apparently she's an 'actress.'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roberts moves the mouse to see Ginger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's the chick?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We don't know yet, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Serious piece of talent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Way outta his league. Something's up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know he also has a ten-year- old daughter, who he's not supposed to see. Maybe that's why he's here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roberts looks at him like he's an idiot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Or maybe not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want to know who that girl is. Pronto.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roberts stands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And stake out his daughter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The house is at the very top of the hills and the pool hangs off the side of the cliff, way below the house. The outer edge appears nonexistent, like the water hangs frozen in air. A very hip but very nasty soiree is in progress.    More Ibiza than Hollywood Hills. Stanley sits in a chair beside a pool containing a half- dozen beautiful un-clad model-types. Gabriel is mingling through the crowd.

dialogues.speaker: STANLEY
dialogues.text: Stanley stares off into the glittering lights of L.A. WIDEN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiles)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So Stan, tell me. How'd you do it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Break the code. At the club. You broke the entire encryption, a silencer against your eye and your cock in someone's mouth, all in less than sixty seconds. How?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I used a logic bomb, dropped it through the trap door --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, you didn't. You didn't have time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mon, you can do better than that. How'd you do it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I used a password sniffer. Gabriel glances at Ginger who shakes her head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh uh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, I did --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mon, Stanley. How'd-you-do-it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know exactly. I see the numbers. In my head. All my life. I don't answer equations, I just see the answers. Same with code. I can't explain ---

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ginger eases over to where Stan is sitting. She runs her hands across his shoulders as she moves around him, dancing to the MUSIC.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mozart always said he didn't write music; he just wrote down what he heard in his head. So did Faulkner, just with words.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (drinking wine) You definitely have a gift, Stan. The most powerful people on the planet are like you. With a laptop and a phone line you can make God look like a thirteen-year-old with a stack of Playboys and a lack of imagination. (beat) C'mere, Stan, let me show you something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stanley and Gabriel stand in Gabriel's primo designed pad, staring at an array of supercomputers. Stanley stands in front of the six huge flat panels, linked together, in complete awe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pretty impressive, huh. (beat) So...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here's the deal. I need a worm, Stanley. A hydra, actually. A multi-headed worm to break an encryption and then sniff out latent digital footprints throughout an encrypted network.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What kind of cypher?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vernam encryption.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A Vernam's impossible. Its key code is destroyed upon implementation. Not to mention being a true 128 bit encryption.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Actually, we're talking 512 bit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's impossible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell ya what, I'll pay you ten million dollars. That should be enough to get your daughter back... (beat) ... unless of course it's impossible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stan thinks about it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing's impossible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They shake hands and Gabriel heads toward the back of the house.

dialogues.speaker: GABRIEL
dialogues.text: walking up the stairs toward his room. Stan looks over to see Ginger staring at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ginger pulls herself up on the desk, spreading her legs on either side of the keyboard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mon, Stan.   Let's get to work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She turns on the computers.     He backs away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It won't bite you, I promise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. It's gonna be pretty hard without a gun to my head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She reaches out and pulls him to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, let's put a gun to your head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She kisses him and slowly he responds.       She smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell me about your worm, Stanley.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They kiss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You surprised that a girl with real breasts and an I.Q. over 70 can give you a hard-on?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stan shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought you were Gabriel's.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks at him a moment. She smiles at him and slowly bends forward to whisper in his ear.

dialogues.speaker: GINGER'S MOUTH
dialogues.text: at Stanley's ear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (very slowly) I am not what you think I am.

dialogues.speaker: GINGER AND STANLEY
dialogues.text: As she leans back. She stares at him a moment then slides off the desk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're a smart guy, Stanley.    You figure me out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She hands him the bottle of expensive wine she's been drinking, and then grabbing Stan by the belt-buckle, pulls him casually behind her toward the pool house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lounging by the pool is none other than our heroine, Ginger, topless, wearing nothing more than tiny, oblong, green-tinted shades, a skimpy T-back, and a little silver ring through her left nipple. She's reading Steven Hawkings' A Brief History of Time. A shadow falls over her. The shadow moves.       Ginger glances nonchalantly up, t

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sitting up, grinning) Don't you have that just-fucked- the-neighbor's-cat look this morning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She reaches over, lights a cigarette, and inhales deeply. He smiles, looking her up and down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Problem?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pretty impressive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought we went over all that last night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (beat, then like "stupid") The book, Ginger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ohhh. (holding it out) Look, no pictures. Get out of my light.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: They stare at each sharing a moment of God-only-knows- what, then both break into smiles like two giddy seventh- graders at the local skating rink. Stanley nervously clears his throat.    She's got him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I borrow your car? There's something I need to do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She reaches down beside the chair, grabs her keys and tosses them to him. Then:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you're going to see your daughter, you might want to reevaluate the way you look. (goes back to her book) Just a thought.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks at her with open mouth amazement. In just 24 hours, she already knows what makes him tick. She looks up from her book and winks at him, then returns to her reading.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A SCHOOL BELL RINGS and three hundred screaming kids of all ages come running from the doors.

dialogues.speaker: HOLLY
dialogues.text: Not your average ten-year-old. Even decked out in bell- bottoms and sandals there is something about the way she carries herself that is older; wiser; sadder. She walks into a CLOSEUP and scans the driveway. Reflected in her tiny, round lavender shades we see the circular driveway of the school jam-packed with buses and parental types in their M-series Mercedes and their Lexus SUVs. She sighs. We CRANE UP, PANNING LEFT. Holly walks to the edge of the street oblivious to the mayhem. She looks up and down the street then slowly drops her backpack and sits down on the curb. She pulls a well-worn copy of William Gibson's Neuromancer from her backpack, and turns up the raging ELECTRONICA from her WALKMAN.

dialogues.speaker: SAME SCENE
dialogues.text: Now there is much less pandemonium. No more buses. We CRANE DOWN TO a MEDIUM of Holly still in the exact same spot. Holly sighs, pulls back her headphones and grabs her StarTac from her backpack. She opens the phone and dials.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The PHONE RINGS and we PAN AROUND the seemingly empty house, finally COMING TO REST ON the back of the couch. We JIB UP and TILT DOWN. Melissa is passed out in a pool of her own drool. The PHONE continues to RING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holly hits the phone and then presses speed dial. We see "Yellow Cab" scroll across the phone. She hits "SEND."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I give you a lift?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, creep, I don't think so -- She stands up, ready for a fight. And there, next to her is her father; transformed. Under his arm is a three- foot-tall stuffed giraffe wrapped with a big red bow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daddy? (recognition)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daddy! She runs to him and wraps her arms around him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, sweetheart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daddy... What are you doing here? I missed you so much.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me too, baby.    I brought you something. He holds the stuffed giraffe to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, Daddy. If Mom finds out you're here she's gonna have you thrown back in jail.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's okay, baby. Let me give you a ride home. He grabs her stuff.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mon. He walks toward Ginger's silver Mercedes CLK which he's borrowing. Holly runs and jumps on his back. They laugh as he carries her to the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They sit in the CLK, parked down the street from Holly's house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You believe in me, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course, but --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've found a way to get you back, sweetheart. It's my one shot and I'm taking it. Just give me a couple of days.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (crying)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want anything else to happen to you, Dad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holly, everything's going to be okay. You just have to trust me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (crying)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love you, Daddy. Holly quickly kisses him, jumps out and runs, crying, from the car at full speed, with the giraffe. Stanley, tears rolling down his face, slaps the steering wheel, trying to figure out how he screwed up his life so badly. Suddenly, the passenger door opens and a man in a DARK BLUE SUIT and fed-issued shades gets in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who the fuck are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (flipping out his badge)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Friend of a friend. Let's take a ride. He motions toward a black Taurus, now parked across the street. In the back, he sees a face he recognizes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The man kinda smiles at Stan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (being a dick) Gotta suck to be you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stanley whacks the fed with his elbow across the bridge of his nose and jumps out of the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stan runs across the hood of the Taurus and just jumps over the railing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We realize what Stan did probably wasn't the smartest move in the world. The cliff is just barely on this side of 90 degrees and drops off about five hundred yards straight down to the PCH. Stan falls in SLOW MOTION about thirty feet before the cliff face angles out enough to break his fall. He begins a combination of sliding and tumbling down the bluff.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roberts runs to the railing and sees Stanley sliding/ falling down the hill.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to his men) Cut him off at the bottom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roberts then hops the railing, as his men scramble for the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roberts hangs in mid-air a moment, then he too begins the rolling fall down the hill.

dialogues.speaker: STANLEY
dialogues.text: as he tries to keep his balance, is being beaten and battered by the sharp, rocky ground. Finally, he shoots off an outcropping and free-falls for fifteen feet. Then it really gets bad. Clear plastic sheeting has been stretched across the hill to help control the erosion. To Stanley however, it is the world's largest Slip and Slide. He is no longer able to control, even badly, his descent. Now, he is flying down the cliff face, only the rocks and bushes that slam into his body, slows the descent. Roberts, above him, is doing little better.

dialogues.speaker: CLIFF FACE
dialogues.text: As Stan and Roberts slide toward the eight lanes of blazing afternoon traffic on the PCH. Finally, Stan bounces onto the black-top road.   He runs headlong into the traffic. CARS SCREECH, HORNS BLARING, as they slide into each other. Stanley does not lose the single-minded focus of escaping. Roberts, now at   the bottom himself, watches as a CAR SLIDES sideways   into Stan, flipping him over it. Stan, not stopping to   feel the pain, runs across the hood of freshly-stopped   car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the other side, Stan runs down to the beach and runs down the sand at full-tilt, looking for any escape route. Roberts has made up some time due to the auto-pedestrian accident which slowed him down a little. Stan however is faster. Stan does his best Jerry Rice, as he runs down the beach at full speed. Suddenly, the Taurus comes tearing-ass across the beach at Stanley. Stan veers, now running through the surf. The Taurus veers as well, and Stan is forced to slide across the hood to keep from getting whacked. The Taurus breaks left, and slides further into the surf. The FBI driver hits the accelerator and bogs the Taurus down, tires spinning, throwing sand. Stan continues to run as Roberts makes it to the Taurus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck this. He pulls his .40 CAL. from his shoulder holster and FIRES it into the air. Roberts bends over trying to catch his breath. Stanley stops, putting his hands up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why didn't you do that earlier, sir? Roberts looks at the agent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go get him. Three of the agents bring Stanley over. Stan slides down by the back wheel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing in L.A., Stan?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (catching his breath)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vacationing...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why were you running? We just wanted to talk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you arresting me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For violating your parole by leaving Texas without permission or for evading a federal agent and almost getting me killed in the process?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stan just looks at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I'm not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then why are we talking?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Didn't know the court lifted the sanction preventing you from seeing your daughter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You just want to cut through the pleasantries and get down to business? Fine. I can help you with your daughter, Stan. Help me, I'll help you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll have to forgive me, the fact that you put me in jail for 18 months doesn't inspire a lot of trust.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whether I agreed with what you did or not, you broke the law, Stanley.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess we were both doing what we had to. This was a nice trip down memory lane, but if you're not arresting me...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, why was it you are in L.A. again?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told you --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- vacationing. That's right. Ya know it's funny. Axl Torvalds was just here for a vacation, too. Isn't it odd that the two best hackers in the world are here at the same time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm a sucker for Disneyland. (getting up) Tell Torvalds I said hello.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you're not careful you can tell him yourself. He's dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stanley looks at Roberts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to his men) Give him a card.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They do.   Stan looks at it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In case you think of anything else you want to tell me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stan turns to walk off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to the agent he elbowed) Sorry about your nose.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Stan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stan turns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, you're in way over your head here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (walking off) I know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a long walk back up the hill, Stanley. You want us to give you a lift?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stan lifts his middle finger behind him and begins the long journey back up the hill. Roberts collapses into the passenger seat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Follow him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yessir.

dialogues.speaker: ROBERTS
dialogues.text: watching Stan walk away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ginger walks in and closes the door. She walks over to the dresser and takes off her earrings. Then she reaches under her dress and unVelcros the modified 10mm. Glock and its thigh holster, dropping it on the dresser. She then pulls off the hip, little designer dress she is wearing, revealing the fact that she is wearing a tiny transmitting receiver taped between her breasts. She stares at herself in the mirror for a moment, then slowly starts to untape the bug.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have to hand it to you, Ginger. You look good wearing anything. Even a wire.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ginger grabs her Glock and spins around, the holster dropping away with the touch of a button. She levels it on the dark corner of the room where Stanley sits waiting, drinking a bottle of Gabriel's expensive wine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You gonna kill me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm thinking. (beat) What are you doing here, Stanley?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I should probably ask you the same question.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He leans forward into the light.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened to you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Little accident. (tossing her her keys) Sorry about your car. I've had a pretty shitty day so far. Looks like it just got worse. (beat) Who are you, Ginger?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't tell you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (incredulous) You can't tell me? Well, that's just fuckin' peachy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Think, Stanley.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (loudly) Who are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He'll kill me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gabriel walking down hallway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's not my problem, is it? You're asking for a lot of faith here, Ging, without givin' me any. You --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Stanley --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- brought me into this mess --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pleadingly) -- Stanley --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- I deserve to know who's playing me, Ginger. (hitting each word) Who the fuck are you?

dialogues.speaker: GABRIEL
dialogues.text: nearing Ginger's room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (quietly) I'm D.E.A., Stanley.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stan and Ginger hold a moment, as:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ginger...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stanley, in one quick thinking movement, rips the wire from Ginger's chest and flings it behind the bed just as the door swings open. Gabriel stands staring at them. Ginger topless, weapon in hand and Stanley who looks like he had the shit kicked out of him. Ginger and Stanley both stare at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, Ging, doesn't this look friendly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm a friendly girl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stanley looks at Ginger for a beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Actually...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ginger stares at Stanley, who turns to look at Gabriel. Gabriel looks at Stan, waiting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thought maybe you'd like to see me get you your hydra.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get?

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Stan walks toward Gabriel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gabriel walks into the hall. Stanley looks back at Ginger who mouths the words "Thank you." Stanley ignores her. Ginger reaches down and grabs a shirt off the bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You look like shit. Ginger kick your ass?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (deadpan) Funny.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ginger sighs and tosses her gun onto the bed, then follows them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stanley, looking a little rough, sits in front of the huge array of flat-panels. He works quickly. The nitrogen system, an array of hoses winding across the living room floor, intermittently SHOOTS JETS of GAS upwards, dropping the temperature to a livable 85 degrees. Gabriel sits next to Stan. Ginger walks in.      She stands behind Stan as he works.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miss me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Terribly.

dialogues.speaker: COMPUTER
dialogues.text: The screen shows the MIT University logo.      Then "ACCE DENIED." His fingers work the keyboard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As he talks, we TRACK DOWN an old, concrete stairwell and down a long, dank hallway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My senior year at M.I.T., I created the source code for the worm that I've been using for years.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We TRACK AROUND a corner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the basement and through a file room is the only P.D.P.-10 still active and on the internet, although only a few people know this. It's an I.T.S. machine and kept online just for historical sake. I hid my worm inside it where no one would ever think to look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We DOLLY INTO a CLOSEUP ON a large, ominous, dark mainframe.

dialogues.speaker: STANLEY'S FINGER
dialogues.text: hitting a key.

dialogues.speaker: PDP-10
dialogues.text: as it HUMS TO LIFE.

dialogues.speaker: COMPUTER SCREEN
dialogues.text: as it fills with lines of code.

dialogues.speaker: STAN
dialogues.text: who turns around, a cocky grin on his face, like a proud parent, she smiles at him. Gabriel walks in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now I just have to modify the code.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's fucking amazing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes he is.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: She runs her hand affectionately across the side of his head and walks out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I see you have a groupie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (ignoring that) You know, it'd be a lot simpler if you would tell me exactly what the hydra is going to be used for?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PUSH IN ON Gabriel as he thinks about it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have you heard of Operation Swordfish?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nope.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Lamborghini pulls up in front of a Starbucks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll appreciate the irony here --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gabriel gets out of the car, still talking.       Stanley follows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- In the early Eighties the D.E.A. set up a network of dummy corporations as a government front to launder drug money and gather evidence.
