Problem is, the front companies started making money. Lots of money. By 1986, when Operation Swordfish was terminated, there was close to 400 million dollars in the D.E.A.'s accounts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gabriel and Stanley walk through the door and sit down at a window table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Money that just sorta disappeared.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It didn't disappear. It just sat in those accounts earning interest, it's been 15 years. You have any concept how much money we'd be actually talking about today? Billions, brother. That's nine zeros. (beat) Look, this is a sweet deal. We go in over phone lines. Pop the firewall, drop in the hydra, and just sit back and wait for the money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Before we can tap into the secure cluster, you have to find one of the banks on the backbone of this network. Do you know how many banks there are in the U.S.? It could take years.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No problem. (beat) Look behind you, Stan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stanley turns and looks out the window.    They are sitti directly across from the World Banc.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gabriel and Stanley walk toward the house. The CAMERA PANS LEFT and we can now see Gabriel's house, poolside. We PULL BACK, THROUGH a window INTO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A small trailer across the canyon from Gabriel's house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who is he?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We don't know that yet, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's definitely something going on. There are two T-5 trunks going into the house. That's serious bandwidth. Thermal scopes indicate a huge heat-load in the main living area. Could be from mainframes, although they must have a genny 'cause power consumption is right on par.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Some of these fellows might be dressed in Armani, but they definitely have the swagger of ex- military. Maybe bodyguards but they seem more like mercs to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From here we're having trouble pinning any of them down. Sure would be nice to task a satellite, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm working on it. Send what you have up-lines, maybe we'll have one by the end of the week.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roberts walks out of the trailer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stanley works at the computer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roberts looks out the window through a camera with a huge lens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gabriel stands by the pool, his BACK TOWARD US. Slowly, Gabriel turns around. He is staring directly AT US.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roberts instinctively jerks his head up.    Slowly he loo back into the eyepiece.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who the hell is that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He presses the switch and the CAMERA'S SHUTTER WHIRLS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Senator.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Close the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He does.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have a problem. (walking toward desk) Look at these.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kaplan spreads out the surveillance photos on the desk. The Senator looks up at Kaplan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reisman, who now stands in a windowless room. The only furniture is a desk on which rests a small laptop and what appears to be a speaker. An OPERATOR sits at the desk, while Kaplan hovers in the b.g.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have him yet?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's coming online now, sir. Ready.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Reisman speaks the Communication guy types.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have a problem --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gabriel and Marco sit at the same type of apparatus, a merc at the laptop. Reisman's dialogue comes out of the SPEAKER, but it is no longer Reisman, it is a COMPUTERIZED VOICE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Seems you have gotten yourself in a predicament.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not exactly following you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Transfer the pictures.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gabriel looks at the surveillance photos as they come up. We INTERCUT as they speak.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (irritated but respectful) Senator, I sincerely hope you did not contact me and jeopardize the safety of me and my men for this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goddamn right I did. You know where I got that? From the deputy director of the F.B.I. He thought I might be interested.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir, with all due respect. Do you think there is any aspect of this operation I am not fully aware of?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We are aborting the operation and securing alternative means of finance elsewhere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We are aborting this operation. Take a vacation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A vacation?   Have I ever failed you, sir?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's not the point.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's my point. Senator, this operation is going forward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You understand what you are saying?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everything is under control.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He disconnects.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reisman turns to Kaplan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (regretful) Do it. Terminate the Vortex.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yessir. (beat) Sir, he does work for us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse us. (as the Communication guy leaves) Son, let's say you have a 200- pound Rottweiler. He loves you, and it's his job to protect you. But if he ever bites you, even once, you gotta put him down. You can't have an uncontrollable weapon running unchecked in your back yard. He becomes a liability. You never know who he might bite next.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yessir, I understand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stanley works at the keyboard. He reaches for his glass of wine and it is empty. He grabs the bottle. It, too, has been drained. He sighs and walks into the kitchen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stan walks to the fridge. Opens the door. No wine. He sighs. He closes the door and walks off toward the wine cellar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the wine cellar, Stan looks around. He opens one door, closes it. He opens another, same thing. The third, he pulls out a bottle. Keeps it. He pulls on another door and it is locked. He pulls again. Nothing. The glass doors of the temperature-controlled reach-in wine cooler is opaque with condensation. He bends close. Stanley swipes off the condensation inches from his nose.

dialogues.speaker: ON FACE
dialogues.text: leaning against the glass from the other side.    It's Gabriel's.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck!! He drops the BOTTLE of wine.   CRASH, it SHATTERS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gabriel's body is wedged into the 32-degree white wine cooler.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus Christ! Stanley looks at the body for a moment, realizes something really bad is going on and hauls ass upstairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stanley runs around the corner. Gabriel is standing in the doorway, directly in front of Stanley. Stan damn near falls down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stan? Stan can't say a word.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's wrong, Stanley, you look like you've seen a ghost?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gabriel looks in and sees the empty wine bottle at the computer station.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mon, Stanley. Let's talk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (uneasy) Okay...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why can't we talk here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Cause I don't want to talk to you in the house, Stanley.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gabriel walks out.       Stanley slowly follows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stan slowly follows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How you doing, Stanley?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (obviously not fine) Fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something you need to say to me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (freaked) What the hell is going on here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (totally cool) You know anything about Harry Houdini?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stan definitely doesn't get the point.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He used to make an elephant disappear in a theater full of people. You know how he did it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gabriel unwraps a piece of gum --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- and sticks the piece in his mouth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Misdirection.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gabriel whips right down a side street and drops the hammer. He blows through a stop sign, then another. CARS CRASH. He is calm, cool, but continues to glance in his rearview mirror.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have a tail. (beat) Hope you had a light lunch, Stan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gabriel slides left into an alley, gets it under control and SCREAMS toward the other side. A black Suburban pulls up, closing off the alley. He slides to a stop and slams it into reverse. Backwards at 60-plus miles per hour.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hold the wheel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gabriel reaches in the passenger floorboard and pulls up a duffel bag. He unzips it, and withdraws what the Marines call a SAW -- a Belgian-designed machine gun, compact but with 1500 rounds of Swiss cheese action per minute, powerful enough for the U.S. to replace the M-60.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit, it's blocked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gabriel looks behind them, another black Suburban has blocked them in. The one from the other side and a third comes toward them down the alley.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keep it straight.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: The speedometer needle is pegged at 0 as they SCREAM backwards. Gabriel unfolds the stock and then withdraws a 100-round box wrapped in white tape and printed with AP. He clips it and pulls back the bolt. He grabs the wheel from Stan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's just rough when you grow up lovin' James Bond movies. Don't worry, Stanley, it'll be over soon.

dialogues.speaker: LAMBO
dialogues.text: As the Diablo slams backwards into the Suburban at sixty mph. Bam. Gabriel unbuckles himself and stands up through the open roof and UNLOADS FULL-AUTO into the Suburban. The armor- piercing SHELLS PENETRATE the Armalite GLASS, RIPPING the occupants to shreds. Gabriel turns, FIRING at the other Suburban.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Drive, drive!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stanley slides under Gabriel as Gabriel steps into the passenger side. The wheels spin, the Lambo is wedged under the Suburban.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go, go!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gabriel continues to BLAST FULL-AUTO, tearing the Suburban to shrapnel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Finally the mortally wounded but still kicking Lamborghini tears free of the Suburban and rockets head- toward the other. Stanley drives like a maniac. Gabriel RIPS it on FULL-AUTO, meatloafing the driver. The Suburban veers into the wall. Smack. Stanley whips beside it and Gabriel STRAFES down the side, opening it up. Stan whips right onto a main street.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: More Suburbans head at them. Stan SCREAMS left into another alley. Through the cross streets whipping by at 100 mph, we see Suburbans parallel to them. Stan cranks his wheel right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (changing out a clip) Keep your cool, Stanley.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Lambo rolls to a stop and Gabriel hops out, running at the Suburbans. After a moment of all-out GI Joe-style blitzkrieg, it's over. Gabriel walks to a body lying in the street.    He turns over the body and looks at the face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goddamit.   I knew it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gabriel walks back to one of the burning Suburbans where Stanley stands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get in the fucking car, Stanley.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not going anywhere until you tell me what's going on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gabriel pulls out his H&K, points it at Stanley.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're on my good side and you want to stay there. Stanley, I like you, but don't confuse kindness with weakness. So, get in the fuckin' car. I need my hydra.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stanley is working at his terminal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stanley?   You alright?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you think? I just watched that maniac murder ten men in the street. I'm just fucking great. It doesn't matter if I get my daughter back if I'm dead. Even if I do survive this, who's gonna keep me out of jail? You? She walks over to him and kneels down, places her hand on his leg, looks up at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I won't let anything happen to you, Stanley. You have to trust me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trust you? Two hours ago I found out you're D.E.A. The feds are crawling up my ass and there's a dead body in the basement that looks just like Gabriel. She doesn't move.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stanley, if we don't find out who he's working for then we're just going to have to do this all over again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your little slush fund is not my problem. I'm pulling the plug on this rodeo. Roberts may be an asshole, but he is definitely the lesser of the two evils.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've been working on this thing for eight months, and I will not let some jarhead fed fuck up my operation. Please, I know what I'm doing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mon, Stanley. You have twelve hours. Do what he wants. Finish the worm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're starting to sound just like him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They look at each other.    Stanley turns toward the computer screens.

dialogues.speaker: OMITTED
dialogues.text: & 96

dialogues.speaker: FLY-FISHING REEL
dialogues.text: as it quickly unwinds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reisman, dressed in your average, fly-fishing garb, stands in the shallow water of a wide river, thinking he has contained the situation, is doing what he enjoys most. He rewinds the reel and flicks it out again; the hook sails into the distance. A huge Cohiba cigar hangs from his satisfied grin. Faintly, we hear the WHINE OF MACHINERY. Jim hears it, too, odd since we are so far in the boonies. He looks around, then up and we PUSH IN TO a CLOSEUP.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An evil-looking, camouflaged gunship suddenly crests the hill directly above him, ROTORS THUMPING.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE
dialogues.text: Reisman ducking, his cigar falling from his mouth, has to fight to hold on to his ridiculous fishing hat.

dialogues.speaker: ABOVE HELICOPTER
dialogues.text: Water sprays everywhere as it hovers. Slowly it drifts over to the bank and lowers where it touches down briefly, the side door slides open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as Gabriel steps out and walks TOWARD us.     The copter lifts off behind him.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE
dialogues.text: Reisman drops his rod and digs into the fishing box at his right. Gabriel saunters toward him as the helicopter disappears over the rise. Reisman is not happy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sniffing in air) Ahh, the great American outdoors. I'll never understand the appeal of fly-fishing, Jim. A little too much like masturbation for me, without the payoff.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gabriel looks around, suddenly realizing something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This's a catch-and-release stream, isn't it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gabriel starts to laugh.      Reisman doesn't catch the j

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh c'mon, Jim. You gotta see the irony in the chairman of the Joint Sub-Committee on Crime, fishing in a catch-and-release stream.

dialogues.speaker: REISMAN
dialogues.text: Grimaces, not thinking it is funny.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How could you do it, Jim? After all we have sacrificed. All the blood, all the death... I've changed my identity so many times, I don't even know what I look like anymore. How could you turn on me when we are so close?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You did this to yourself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You brought me in to get the job done and you didn't want to know about the consequences.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The F.B.I. was watching you --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told you there was nothing that I was unaware of --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's why we're here. You are too arrogant, too aggressive --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have misplaced your loyalties, Senator. You have sold America out. I am a patriot, and patriotism does not have a four-year shelf life. Unfortunately, politicians do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gabriel pulls out his H&K, dangling it by his side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (arrogantly) And what are you going to do with that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thomas Jefferson once shot a man on the White House lawn for treason, Senator. You tried to execute me in the name of politics, now I execute you in the name of the people.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gabriel shoots Reisman in the chest.     He falls into th water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stanley continues to work.   Marco walks in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're up, mate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Great.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get your shit, we're headin' out. His hands fly across the computer keys, he slides in a zip disk, transfers the file, and runs for the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Outside, Marco waits in his black Porsche Turbo ready to roll. Stanley walks out of the house.

dialogues.speaker: OMITTED
dialogues.text: thru

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A snazzy, sweat-suited Kaplan walks out to his shiny new silver Porsche, racquet ball racquet flipping in hand. He's so downright happy in his confidence that he is on the fast track to political Valhalla, due to his handling of this Gabriel Shear debacle, he is whistling. He CLICKS the Porsche key, unlocking the driver's door, tosses in his racquet and climbs in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He shuts the door and slides the key into the ignition. Before he cranks it, he catches himself in the rearview and winks at himself. Smiling, he turns the key. BOOM. The Claymore Mine hidden under his seat RIPS the CAR apart, shrapnel tearing upward through his body and out the roof.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The thousand pieces of SHRAPNEL divet the concrete ceilin and then bounce across the parking garage floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stanley is getting out of Marco's car.    Gabriel walks o of the theater back door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (over shoulder)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Make sure that bus doesn't top out over fifteen-seven.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yessir. Gabriel turns and sees Stanley.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stan, how are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have you finished? Stan pulls out the zip disk and hands it to Gabriel who dials his cell phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? (into phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello, Mr. Jobson. This is Kristine Jorgenson of Credit Suisse in Grand Cayman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need to verify your new account information and have you choose a personal password.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Jobson, there has just been a transfer of ten million U.S. dollars into your account.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stan looks at Gabriel who smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just like I promised, Stanley.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then let me go. I want to see my daughter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Soon, Stanley.     Walk with me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm about to do something against my better judgement. I'm going to tell you something I never tell anyone. I'm going to tell you who I am.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't bother.     I know who you are.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you?    You think I'm a bank robber.    Really, I'm just like you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like me?   You're a murderer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That I am. And worse. Much worse. I am forced to operate on a different plane than you. But, I have ethics. Rules to which I must adhere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 200 years ago Thomas Jefferson wrote a letter to Madison because he was concerned that the freedoms of the constitution would be ignored.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't understand why the fuck you're telling me this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen to me and you will. In the 1950s, armed with this letter, J. Edgar Hoover created an organization to protect the freedoms of this country at all costs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't care about any of this. All I care about is my daughter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm talking about your daughter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My daughter...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. You, your daughter and 200 million other Americans who take their freedoms for granted. You don't understand what it takes to protect those freedoms. That's my job, Stanley, to protect your way of life at all costs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you and your band of lunatics are really stealing all this money to protect me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's right, Stanley --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He opens the theatre door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- 'cause wars cost money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stan inside. It's as if he's just teleported into Beirut. Weapons, Hummers, a huge armored bus is jacked up at one end of the theatre. Gabriel's men go about readying themselves. One of the mercs walks over to Gabriel to show a modified electronic dog collar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (realization hitting him) You're going into the fucking bank.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's what I'm telling you, Stanley. We are at war.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: War?   Who are we at war with?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anyone who infringes on America's freedom. Terrorists' states, Stanley. Someone must take their war to them. They bomb a church, we bomb ten. They hijack a plane, we take out an airport. They execute American tourists, we tactically nuke an entire city. We must make terrorism so horrific that it becomes unthinkable to attack Americans.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm out. I'm not doing this. You're insane.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe. I wanted you to do this because you wanted to, because we need men like you, but our time table's been moved up. Just relax and it will all be over in twenty-four hours. You're rich, Stanley. Pretty soon Holly and you will be basking in the sun on the deck of some eighty-foot scarab, eating bon bons and living the good life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He turns to walk off. Stanley looks around. He spots a generator and moves toward it. Stanley reaches down to the power board on the generator and gives a large dial a twist.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Suddenly, the hundreds of lights in the rack begin to arc. In a shower of GLASS they start EXPLODING from the huge amperage shooting through them from the generator. Gabriel turns to see Stan standing next to the generator. He moves toward him just as the room goes black. In a moment the secondary lights come up.    No Stanley.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to himself) Pretty slick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (walking over) You want to send a team after him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. He'll be back. We gotta move. Load up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Early morning in Los Angeles.    People go peacefully abo their early morning business. Suddenly, three red, white and blue Hummers crest a hill and tear TOWARD us down the street. Halfway down the street, they veer right, jump the curb, and SMASH through the front PLATE-GLASS WINDOWS of the World Banc.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stanley rides in the back of a cab as the cab hauls ass to his ex-wife's house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the Hummers roll through the furniture and flying glass, the side doors fling open and well-dressed men in Italian suits and sunglasses jump out. Customers scream and try to flee but are quickly corralled with MACHINE GUN BURSTS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A red FERRARI F50 whips around the corner at light speed, SCREAMS down the street TOWARD us and SCREECHES to a halt outside the bank. It shifts into reverse and slowly backs over the curb and into the bank. A huge armored bus rolls down the street, through two parked cars, and up onto the sidewalk, effectively sealing off the front of the glass bank. Mercs begin welding metal plates around the armored bus. We hear the approaching SIRENS of a fleet of cop cars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cab pulls up in front of Melissa's house.   Stanley jumps out and runs up to the front door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Several of the mercs finish putting some sort of collars on several hostages, including a young, normally good- looking-but-now-covered-in-mascara, whimpering blonde girl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stanley busts into her house. In the living room, Melissa and the infamous Larry the Porn King are both face-down in a pool of blood. Stan freaks. He runs from room to room yelling Holly's name. The house is deserted. Stanley bursts through the door into Holly's room. The room is empty and in disarray.

dialogues.speaker: STANLEY
dialogues.text: As he looks out the window toward LA and pulls out Roberts' card.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THROUGH glass doors, we see the woman slam into the locked doors. The SWAT guy pulls her into the street.

dialogues.speaker: KABOOM
dialogues.text: The EXPLOSION rips the SWAT guy and the girl from the beginning apart. This time we see it from ANOTHER ANGLE. BALL BEARINGS RICOCHET against the plate steel of the bank.

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: as the ball bearings bounce across the street and tap against the coffee shop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone in the coffee shop looks at each other like, "What the fuck just happened?"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As ball bearings roll back into the street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stanley is standing in the bank. Three mercs in Donna Karen suits point modified M-16s at his head. He stares at the ground, shaking his head. Gabriel tosses his frappacino against the wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get that son-of-a-bitch on the phone. Gabriel walks towards the window, slinging his FN-FAL, and pulling on his headset. A.D. Joy answers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you need to test my resolve then God help you. You have 25 minutes. That plane better be on the runway. He clicks off.    He turns to Stan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get my money, Stanley.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not until I see my daughter. Gabriel snaps his fingers and a ballistic cloth duffel bag is thrown to Gabriel. Gabriel is very unhappy. He looks at Stanley who is terrified of its contents.

dialogues.speaker: DUFFEL BAG
dialogues.text: As he unzips it.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO STANLEY
dialogues.text: Stanley almost can't bear to look.

dialogues.speaker: DUFFEL BAG
dialogues.text: As Gabriel slowly reaches in and... Pulls out our buddy the giraffe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stanley's heart almost stops.    He sighs as Gabriel toss him the giraffe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you really think I wanted it to come to this. Do you? I am not a psychopath, Stanley, but I told you, I will sacrifice as many lives as it takes to protect our country, including my own. (beat) Now get me my money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will you let Holly go once you have the money?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Both of you. You have my word, Stanley. C'mon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They walk past a merc sitting at a desk, a laptop open in front of him. Marco is paying very close attention to Stan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A merc sits at a desk with three laptops and four tiny extra monitors, all wired into a large bundle of cables that run across the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The   merc looks up. On the monitors and laptop screens are   present-time shots of all angles of the building an the   surrounding area. The images constantly change as the   merc toggles through the images.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look at the cover pattern they've set up. The right hand doesn't know what the left's doing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look at this bozo. If the shit drops, he's gonna cap his buddy in the back of the head. Idiots.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stanley sits down at the computer console and brings up the bank's mainframe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need the disk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A merc hands it to him and Stanley slides it in the computer. His hands work quickly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is 9:15.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now it is 9:35.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Almost done.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly the lights flicker, Stan's screen blanks out momentarily, then blazes back to life, his code scrambled. Stan instinctively jerks his hands away from the keyboard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whoa! What the hell just happened?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gabriel looks at the lights as they flicker back on, the huge portable GENERATOR springing to life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They just cut the power. Forget it. How long to transfer the money?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Couple of minutes. Which accounts?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: National Bank of Zurich. Spread it evenly over these accounts. It won't be there that long.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (dryly) Great.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good job, Stanley, I got someone who wants to see you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They bring Holly out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holly!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stanley grabs her and pulls her close to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holly nods yes. Stanley and Holly are escorted toward the door. Gabriel stands in front, holding his FN-FAL. He is speaking in French to several of the mercs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hold up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stanley stops. Gabriel walks down the steps and unhooks Holly's collar. Stan is about to freak.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Stanley) Told you I was a man of my word, Stanley.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He walks back. Marco unlocks the door. Stanley and Holly look at each other. Holly starts to cry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's okay.    I love you, baby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marco stares at Stanley as they walk out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See ya around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I doubt it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He starts to walk out...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir, the money just disappeared.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The money, it's gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gabriel turns around to look at Stanley.    We ZOOM INTO CLOSEUP. He's pissed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean, gone?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see Stanley. He looks like he just got caught with his hand in the cookie jar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit!   Run, Holly!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get her!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marco pulls his assault rifle but Stanley waylays him. They both hit the ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holly hauls ass into the street. Once the FBI SWAT guys see she is off the sidewalk, they scoop her up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gabriel jerks out his weapon and jams it against Stan's head as he and Marco roll around on the ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Won't do you any good. The money jumps every 60 seconds from one numbered account to another and will for the next ten years. 'Course it wasn't supposed to happen for another six hours. The power surge must have scrambled the internal clock. But, you kill me and you never get a single dollar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gabriel eases up, wheels spinning at millions of RPMs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You let the hostages go and then I'll tell you where and when you can extract the money. We all walk away, nobody gets hurt. The accounts are encrypted with a 1024 bit cipher. Even I can't break through the fire wall. It's my act of God policy. (beat) Deal?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm thinking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A very tense moment passes.      Gabriel looks around. has an idea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell ya what.    No deal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marco pulls a length of towing cable from one of the Hummer's winches and throws the line over one of the 30- foot-high ceiling buttresses. Gabriel grabs the cable as it comes down as two mercs rush in and grab Stanley, one placing a knife to his throat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marco!   Grab Agent Sculley!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marco grabs Ginger and drags her kicking, fighting, over to where Gabriel stands, brandishing the cable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, don't do this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stanley struggles like there is no tomorrow. Gabriel hooks the end into a noose with the tow hook, and puts it over Ginger's head, pulling it taut around her neck. He cuts the cable-tie loose. She digs at them with her fingers. Two mercs rush in and grab Stanley, one placing a knife to his throat. Stanley struggles like there is no tomorrow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In all reality, Stan, she has you to thank for this. That first night in Prague you broke the D.O.D. database that contained her true identity. She's D.E.A., Stan, but without you, I never would have known.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (freaking) What are you doing? Stop!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: String up the D.E.A. bitch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marco hits the power switch. Ginger is yanked up into the air, hanging twenty feet above the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just let her down. I'll do whatever you want.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then get me my money, Stan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stanley looks up at Ginger, valiantly struggling for her life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not doing shit until you bring her down. I'm serious. Let her down. Now!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gabriel yanks out his .40 cal. H&K, turns and SHOOTS hanging Ginger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nooo...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stanley looks at her lifeless body as they lower her. He looks up at Gabriel and runs at him. Gabriel slaps him in the throat, spinning him, and grabs Stan around the neck in the crook of his arm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (close and very serious) Take a moment, big guy. Don't make me put you in a wheelchair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the b.g. two mercs zip Ginger's body into a black body bag and carry her out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You didn't have to kill her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't Stan, you did.    But we're not done yet. (to Marco) Marco...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marco yanks a seventeen-year-old girl up from the floor and puts a gun to her head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There are a lot of hostages here. I cared about Ginger, can you imagine what I could do to someone I don't care about. How long before the money jumps?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sixty seconds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They better hope you installed a back door or it could be a long day. Somebody get me a laptop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A laptop appears. Gabriel hands it to Stanley and nods to the mercs who drop him. Stanley drops to his knees, placing the computer on the ground. Stanley has logged onto the net via modem and we hear that familiar PULSE as he does. He connects onto an encrypted site on the net. His fingers hum over the keys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looking at a screen) Money just jumped.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looking at his watch) Okay, Stan. Sixty seconds.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Sweat rolls down Stanley's face as he works on the machine. Numbers scroll across the screen. Five columns of numbers scroll.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forty-five seconds, Stanley.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need another laptop, logged on!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He tries to keep from looking up at the crying hostage. The columns decrease. Another laptop appears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Twenty seconds, Stan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His fingers still fly. Three columns now.         He work the other laptop with his right hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fifteen.   She's gonna die, Stanley.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two.   Then one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mon, c'mon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It scrolls down to one number.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ten.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The home page for Grand Cayman Banc appears on the other laptop. "Account Number" appears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nine... Eight... Seven.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stanley has typed in the account number and accesses the account. He flies through the transfer information. Account balance. 6.9 billion dollars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need your account number.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Someone hands him a legal pad.         He types it in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Four, three, two...

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: "Transfer?" -- "Yes" -- TRANSFERRING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let her go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stanley jumps up and runs over to Marco.        Gabriel p his gun to the back of Stanley's head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now, goddammit, it's done.   Let her go!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gabriel looks at one of his boys who is checking it with a different laptop. He nods. Marco drops the girl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, that was fun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A MERC holding a cell phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joy says the plane is ready.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, 'bout time for us to leave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They'll never let you escape. You've gone too far.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Au contraire. Do you hear that? (beat) That's the sound of America watching.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We MOVE UP THROUGH the roof of the bank, the sky is filled with the THUMPING of NEWS HELICOPTERS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They lead the hostages, including Stanley, onto the bus. He is pushed down into the back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to the driver) Let's roll.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: The driver pulls the door lever and it closes. The bus pulls into gear and slowly moves forward. The cops and FBI agents just stare vacantly at the bus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You just gonna let them drive the fuck on outta here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There isn't a free cop in a hundred miles that isn't on his ass. He wants a plane. He'll get a plane.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A G5 sits waiting on the tarmac.    SWAT teams move in to cover positions around it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He won't get away. We'll take them at the airport. Let's go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They exit. Roberts tosses the paper he was reading down on the table and walks out, shaking his head.

dialogues.speaker: NEWSPAPER
dialogues.text: The headline reads, "U.S. SENATOR JAMES REISMAN (GEORGIA)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joy and Agent Thomas jump in a waiting car, ready to head toward the airport. Roberts watches them, then com- mandeers another vehicle, tearing ass after the bus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bus rolls down the street. Slowly one by one, car with flashing lights after car with flashing lights pulls up behind it until a convoy rivaling that of the Sugarland Express has built up. Choppers drop out of the air, shadowing the bright yellow school bus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gabriel's voice booms from speakers on the exterior of the bus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think any of us want a repeat of this morning. Keep at least a hundred yards from this bus at all times and I want the airspace for five miles clear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (dropping the mic and turning to the hostages)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ladies and gentlemen, we will be in your lives for approximately 55 more minutes. This bus has just become your new yard. So sit back, think happy thoughts, and this will be over before you can say 'cat in the hat.' Gabriel, smiling, turns to Stanley.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whaddaya think, Stanley?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll never get away. Even if they have to kill everyone on the bus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really? Five hundred bucks says I do. Tell ya what, Stanley, I'll even spot you the five bills. Gabriel walks to the front of the bus, puts on a headset, and keys a mic.

dialogues.speaker: OMITTED
dialogues.text: thru 132

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We are moving through the city. Behind the bus, a huge caravan of police cars and SWAT trucks follow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stan, c'mere. Stan slides out of the seat and walks to the front with Gabriel. All the hostages' eyes are on him. At the front he looks at Gabriel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take a look. Cops block off side streets as the convoy, ala The Gauntlet, rolls through L.A. Gabriel seems to be in complete control, despite being surrounded by every law enforcement officer within a hundred miles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stan turns to Gabriel, angry.   He grabs him, pushing him

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How the fuck can you justify all this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not looking at the big picture. Gabriel pushes him backward against the hand rail.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stanley, here's a scenario. You have the power to cure all of the world's diseases. But the price for this is that you must kill a single, innocent child. Could you kill that child to save the world?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You disappoint me, Stanley.   It's the greatest good. Silence for several beats.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How about ten innocents?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now you're getting it.   How about a hundred?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gabriel becomes intense.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How about a thousand? Not to save the world, but just to preserve our way of life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No man has the right to make that decision. You're no different than any other terrorist.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're wrong, Stanley. Some men are put here to shape destiny, to protect freedom, despite the atrocities they must commit. I am one of those men. Thousands die every day for no reason at all, where is your bleeding heart for them? You give your twenty dollars to Greenpeace every year and think you are changing the world. What countries will harbor terrorists, when they realize the consequences of what I will do? Did you know I can buy nuclear warheads in Minsk for forty million each? I buy half a dozen, I even get a discount.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The driver, looking at his watch, says something to Gabriel in French. Gabriel replies to the driver, also in French.

dialogues.speaker: DRIVER
dialogues.text: as the driver shifts down.

dialogues.speaker: DRIVER'S FOOT
dialogues.text: Pressing down the accelerator.

dialogues.speaker: SPEEDOMETER
dialogues.text: Nudging toward eighty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the fu --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I saw Sugarland Express, Stan. Didn't like the way it ended.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see a sign that says "LAX."          The bus turns off they get to the sign.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought we were going to the airport.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Misdirection, Stanley.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bus hurtles down a road toward a bridge over the LA river.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One of the mercs in the front speaks French again. Gabriel looks around. He smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Faintly, we can hear powerful ROTORS APPROACHING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gentlemen...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stanley looks out the window as two of the mercs scramble through hatches in the roof.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A huge black Sikorsky sky crane drops out of the sky. It has matched speed with the bus dragging four crane cables under it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Within moments, as the bus speeds onto the bridge, the mercs on the roof have hooked the cables to the four hard-points welded into the bus' substructure for just this purpose. The mercs drop back into...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hold on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bus is lifted from the bridge into the air.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roberts, hauling ass after the bus, sees the Sikorsky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well why the fuck not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The SWAT teams sit and just continue to wait for Gabriel, who will never show up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joy and Agent Thomas come SCREECHING up at the airport. Agent Thomas's PHONE RINGS and he answers it. Joy walks over to the SWAT leader.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everything in place?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're ready, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (running up)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think they're coming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean you don't think they're coming?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (listening to the phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bus was just lifted off the street by a giant helicopter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (freaking)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?!?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (laughing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The only way to fly, huh, Stanley. Gabriel says something in French into the radio.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sky crane/bus head toward downtown.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bus flies through the canyons of the downtown buildings as it continues to lift.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly the bus crests a smaller building, and a large sign looms directly in its flight path.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bank right!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Sikorsky swings right but not fast enough. It SMASHES through the sign and heads directly at a huge glass building.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BROKERS in a bullpen go about their trading business. One looks up as the bus flies toward the huge plate glass windows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holy sh... His cohorts look up just as the BUS SLAMS INTO the BUILDING, SHATTERING the WINDOWS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone holds on for dear life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bus falls on one side. The resulting tension snaps the sliced cable and the entire rear section of the bus dangles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chaos. Hostages slam into each other as the bus falls. One of the hostages flies down the center of the bus, collides with Marco, and both go out through the back window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forty feet from the bus they EXPLODE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The concussion BLOWS OUT every WINDOW of the bus.   The hostages scramble to hold on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bus now hangs suspended perpendicular to the ground. The Sikorsky starts to climb again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gabriel turns to the merc driving the bus, who is wearing a headset.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (listening to his headset, then)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll make it, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Sikorsky flies upward to the top of the highest skyscraper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roberts chases after the bus. He looks up, realizing where they are going and veers off, short-cutting toward the skyscraper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Sikorsky attempts to set the bus on the rooftop. The back wheels miss the rooftop and the entire bus starts sliding toward the edge. The Sikorsky lifts the entire bus back up into the air and then gingerly sets it on the rooftop on all four wheels. The CABLES are cut loose from the helicopter, and drop down onto the ROOF with a loud CLANG.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roberts rushes to the building.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The helicopter then disappears upward into the sky.

dialogues.speaker: ON ROOF
dialogues.text: Mercenaries begin to pile off the bus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stan watches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SWAT trucks pull up and SWAT guys roll out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roberts rushes into the skyscraper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SWAT commandos hit the stairs and elevators.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sitting there on a helipad is an evil-looking, matte- black, Explorer helicopter. Gabriel and his men walk off the bus toward the waiting helicopter. Gabriel turns back to Stanley who is standing on the stairs of the bus. We hear the sound of hundreds of SIRENS APPROACHING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, Stanley, gotta fly. Take care of that little girl. Maybe I'll see you again one day.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It can't end like this.     You can't get away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mon, Stan. Everything doesn't always end the way you think it will. (beat, then) 'Sides, audiences love happy endings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gabriel strides away. We hear the WHINE of the EXPLORER as it does its final POWER UP for lift off. Stanley looks around the bus futilely for some way to stop Gabriel. Stan can hear the cavalry about to arrive. The Explorer slowly lifts upward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Explorer shoots upward into the sky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stan looks around, all the hostages look back at him. Stanley sees one of the Stinger missile launchers, broken free of its box.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roberts runs onto the roof and sees Stanley who has the STINGER to his shoulder. He hits the "on" switch and it WHINES TO LIFE. He sights through the scope as the EXPLORER SCREAMS away and pulls the trigger. The MISSILE RIPS OUT of the tube and flies toward the EXPLORER. BOOM. The MISSILE EXPLOSION combined with the fuel creates a tremendous fireball. Roberts runs and tackles Stanley to the ground. Suddenly, SWAT GUYS dressed in full combat gear including masks tha cover their faces surround them. They cuff them.    One of them almost steps on Stanley's face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm F.B.I...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (ignoring him) Check the rest of the hostages, we'll come back for them.

dialogues.speaker: 169B CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Stretchers and EMT medics run into the bus. We CRANE UP. And see the absolute pandemonium of ambulances leaving and police cars arriving.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see DOCTOR MICHEALS leaning over what is left of Gabriel's barely recognizable burned upper torso and head. Stan and Roberts walk into the room through the metal doors and stop at the end of the table. Dr. Micheals nervously looks up at Stanley and steps back. Stanley looks down at the body.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are we sure this is Gabriel?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Micheals walks over to a light-board on the wall and flicks it on. A full dental X-ray glows. Micheals hangs another over-top of it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The body's dentals exactly match the dentals the Israeli government sent us for an ex-Mossad agent named Gabriel Shears.

dialogues.speaker: FACE
dialogues.text: It is indeed Gabriel a.k.a. Gabriel Shear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It sure looks like Gabriel Shear. What the hell was he doing in that bank?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about Ginger?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We searched all the hospitals and morgues but we haven't been able to find her body yet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't find her body?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keep looking. Bodies just don't fucking disappear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roberts' voice slowly FADES as we PUSH IN ON Stanley, internal wheels spinning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to himself) Disappear...

dialogues.speaker: STOCK FOOTAGE
dialogues.text: Houdini's favorite elephant trick going on inside Stan's head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A large crowd of people surrounds Houdini and pale-suited assistants in front of a large elephant in the center ring.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Houdini made an elephant disappear in a room full of people.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His assistants pull a curtain all the way around the elephant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know how he did it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elephant suit.     Filled with his assistants.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see his assistants jump out of the elephant and hang the suit inside the curtains.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Assistants jump out. Blend in with the others.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Houdini's assistants pull back the curtain, melding with the assistants inside, unbeknownst to the audience of course.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Voila. The elephant is gone.   Houdini throws up his hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No more elephant.

dialogues.speaker: FLASHBACK
dialogues.text: in black urban assault gear, pushing Stan to the ground.

dialogues.speaker: STANLEY, (PRESENT)
dialogues.text: Realization sinking in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ginger looks at him, holding her Glock, a wire taped between her breasts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm D.E.A., Stanley.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trust me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- so advanced nowadays you could probably pilot it from your trailer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiling)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Misdirection...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gabriel's "face" smooshed against the glass door.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO ROBERTS, (PRESENT)
dialogues.text: Roberts looks at him inquisitively.

dialogues.speaker: STANLEY
dialogues.text: As a wry Indiana Jones smirk slowly crosses his face.   H slowly shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cheer up, Stan, we got him. You're a hero.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah that's me. Hero. They walk to the door and out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was wrong about you, Stanley. I wanted you to know that. You know, you should take your daughter on vacation. Relax a little, you're lucky to be alive. Stanley slaps Roberts on the arm and walks out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A WOMAN who looks surprisingly like Ginger with blonde hair and dark shades saunters into the Credit Suisse main bank in Monte Carlo. She walks up to a desk and sits down in front of a young female BANK EXECUTIVE. Both women speak in French with SUBTITLES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I would like to transfer money between my employer's accounts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Certainly. May I have your employer's account number and password, please? The Woman slides a piece of paper across the desk as she casually lights a cigarette.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looking at the account number, realizing who she is dealing with) Oh, of course. You realize, how should I say, there is a substantial amount of money in that account.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sexy Woman smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's why I'm here. My employer doesn't like drawing attention to himself. He likes to keep a low profile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Bank Executive keys in the account numbers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course. Would you feel more comfortable dealing with the bank president?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (exhaling) Would you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right away. A glass of Cristal while you... Wait a moment...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There seems to have been a series of large withdrawals out of this account.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's impossible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Woman spins around the terminal. The Executive and the Woman look at each other in astonishment, then both look back at the screen.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: The balance now reads $500.00. We PUSH INTO A CLOSEUP OF the terminal.   Then THROUGH it

dialogues.speaker: TERMINAL
dialogues.text: We PUSH INTO a CLOSEUP of the terminal. Then THROUGH it. We SHOOT THROUGH the system of wires and microchips, DOWN and THROUGH T1 lines, ACROSS the world at light spee and EXIT the computer world FROM...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The screen of Stanley's laptop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everything okay, Dad? Stanley, sitting at a booth, looks up from his laptop at Holly who was studying a road map of Arizona.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everything's fine. Just making the last of some charitable donations.. Stanley finishes, shuts down laptop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How about you, almost done?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (folding up road map)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yep.   Got it all figured out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, let's do it. They leave table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They exit diner. Make their way to a new SUV with a thirty foot tricked out Airstream trailer stretched out behind it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: By the way, where exactly are we going?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Petrified Forest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Petrified Forest. Stanley opens the driver side door of the SUV.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right.   And I'm driving.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holly climbs into the vehicle, as if to take the wheel. Stanley slides in next to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scoot over, you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WE CRANE UP and AWAY as the vehicle pulls out of the desert truck stop...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Know why they call it the Petrified Forest?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.   Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... and drives off down the road.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A MAN, whom we have not seen before but does maintain a certain "Gabriel" air about him, hiding behind shades, leans against a three-hundred-year-old column reading a newspaper. She walks toward him and he signals for the valet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not fucking gonna believe this. Stanley --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- How much he leave?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 500 bucks. He takes the $500 in cash from her hand and hands her the paper. They walk down to the dock, where a 50-foot off- shore cigarette boat waits, a valet standing next to it. He hands the valet the $500. Stepping down into the cigarette boat, he grins up at Ginger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (steppng in next to him)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't seem that upset.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you ever see the Maltese Falcon? She looks at him as he CRANKS UP the CIGARETTE and backs away from the pier.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 1941. Nominated for three Academy Awards, lost, but what the fuck does the Academy know anyway. John Houston's first film and probably Bogey's best. He turns the BOAT around and POWERS out of the bay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At the end, when they realize the bird's a fake, and all they had gone through and sacrificed was for nothing, Gutman, the bad guy in the movie, says, 'well, sir, what do you think, shall we stand here, shed tears, and call each other names, or shall we go to Istanbul?'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Istanbul?   What's in Istanbul?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The, ah, stuff dreams are made of.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They both smile as the CIGARETTE disappears toward the horizon.
